items.q: Which classic board game features a popping plastic bubble in the center called the 'Pop-O-Matic'?
items.explanation: Players press the Pop-O-Matic to roll the die without losing it.

items.q: The main objective of the video game 'Sonic the Hedgehog' is to collect gold coins.
items.explanation: Sonic collects gold rings, not coins like Mario.

items.q: In a standard game of pool (8-ball), the black ball is numbered 8.
items.explanation: The 8-ball is the final ball a player must sink to win.

items.q: What wildly successful sandbox video game involves shooting portals to solve spatial puzzles?
items.explanation: The player uses the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device.

items.q: Which family card game involves playing cards sequentially from 1 to 12 in order to build 'stockpiles'?
items.explanation: The first player to empty their stockpile wins.

items.q: What colorful tile-based game requires players to create runs or sets of numbers, similar to the card game Rummy?
items.explanation: Players use racks to hold their plastic tiles.

items.q: In the game 'Battleship', what classic phrase do you say when your opponent guesses the coordinate of one of your ships?
items.explanation: The goal is to sink all of your opponent's hidden naval fleet.

items.q: What incredibly popular, blocky 3D platforming video game platform allows players to create and play games made by other users, featuring 'Robux'?
items.explanation: The massively multiplayer platform is extremely popular with children.

items.q: Which tabletop game involves trying to guess a word based on a drawing made by your teammate before time runs out?
items.explanation: Drawing skills often lead to hilarious misunderstandings.

items.q: In a game of bowling, what is it called when a player knocks down all ten pins on their first roll?
items.explanation: It is scored as 10 points plus the total of the next two rolls.
